- Would save a huge amount of time

• What do you think is the most helpful advice to share with new delegators, or that you wish you could tell yourself before you hired your first EA?
Insights

- "Commit to putting the time in"
- There are approaches to advance skill faster, but the main thing is schedule a 1-on-1 with your EA, take the time to give feedback
- Try new types of delegation, ideally once a week, you should try delegating something new
- Carve out time to give feedback, give feedback that's extremely specific in batch
- Spend time with other super delegators, ideally once a quarter I have a dinner with the best delegators I can find and geek out on the craziest shit, or watch presentations and give feedback on others' systems

I can delegate more becuase I trust voice notes so much; if there's a thought in your head, immediately voice note it

I do trust Joanne a fair bit, I don't check in on every single task

"I don't think I've changed dramatically over the years with this"; "I should be improving more"

Look at the exact tasks that have been delegated and think creatively about how to do it; how do I get more exposure to other tasks people have delegated
